item.title: Road markings have really worn off, railings are so chipped, 5th October
item.description:
This part of Chatsworth road conjoining Rushmore Road feels really neglected, the paint markings are so worn off sometimes I see people not seeing that’s a crossing. Is it possible to please freshen up the paint on the railings as it feels pretty scruffy.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rushmore Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ramp needed to / from cycle route, 5th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Deptford Church Street, Deptford, London

item.title: Rubbish left and bins across the pavement, 5th October
item.description:
These bins are always across the pavement, over flowing and smelly. Also the motorbikes are always on the pavement too. Items of clothing have been dumped there and it looks untidy.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burwash Road, Plumstead, London

item.title: Silver graffiti with a tag in large spray on the road side of the shelter, 5th October
item.description:
This graffiti has been there a few weeks, the tag has been used in many places. It should be reported as criminal damage to the police so it is recorded. It should have been altered by RBG CCTV camera.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46, The Village, Charlton, London

item.title: Report of Littering Incident – Homesdale Road, Bromley (5 October 2025), 5th October
item.description:
To: Environmental Services London Borough of Bromley Council Subject: Report of Littering Incident – Homesdale Road, Bromley (5 October 2025) Dear Sir/Madam, On the afternoon of 5 October 2025, I witnessed rubbish being thrown from a moving car onto the street on two consecutive occasions. Details of the incident: Vehicle: Yellow Lamborghini Registration number: LJ70 DHL Date and time: 5 October 2025, approximately 12:30 p.m. Location: Homesdale Road, Bromley Items thrown: Two cups containing liquid, discarded onto moving traffic Please find enclosed video evidence clearly showing the act of littering (visible from approximately 00:17 seconds) along with the vehicle’s registration number. This behaviour not only constitutes littering but also presents a serious road safety hazard to other road users. I request that the Council investigate this matter and take appropriate enforcement action under the relevant environmental and traffic safety regulations. Thank you for your attention to this matter. Yours faithfully, Nikhil Pasari
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48, Homesdale Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bathtub and Building Waste Dumped on Wheathill Road, 5th October
item.description:
A bathtub, large bag of timber, and assorted construction waste have been dumped on the pavement at Wheathill Road. The pile is blocking part of the walkway and adds to the growing series of flytipping incidents in this same spot. It’s unacceptable that such large, dangerous waste is being repeatedly left here without any deterrent or lasting council action

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wheathill Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Silly string in Whyte’s woodlands, 5th October
item.description:
This silly string has been on the trees for over a week and will not biodegrade. It’s on the large tree by the bench just past the boating bears and on the tree next to the natural play area. The play area is down the middle path from the bench. The tree is where the big bear is situated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Red Hill, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
